message.content:
Below is a concise breakdown of how the target structure is composed and how to rebuild it from the dictionary blocks without rotating any pieces:

1) ANALYSIS OF MAIN TARGET IMAGE  
• Block Count & Layers  
  – There are 5 total blocks:  
     1 green horizontal block on the bottom,  
     1 orange vertical cylinder in the center,  
     1 green horizontal block on top of the cylinder,  
     2 green vertical blocks standing on the very top.  
  – These blocks form 3 layers:  
     Layer 1: Bottom horizontal green block  
     Layer 2: Orange cylinder + top horizontal green block  
     Layer 3: Two vertical green posts  

• Spatial Relationships  
  – A single green horizontal block sits flat on the bottom.  
  – The orange cylinder stands vertically on that bottom block.  
  – Another green horizontal block is set on top of (and aligned with) the cylinder.  
  – Finally, two tall green blocks stand side by side on top of that upper green block, leaving a central gap (“U”‐shaped profile).  

2) SELECTING REQUIRED BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY  
Needed block indices and their usage:  
• Two copies of index 1 (green horizontal block) – for the bottom and top horizontal pieces.  
• One copy of index 7 (orange vertical cylinder).  
• Two copies of index 3 (green vertical block) – for the two upright “posts.”  

3) STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER  
Use exactly these steps, bottom to top:

{  
  Step1: Move block with index 1  
  Step2: Move block with index 7  
  Step3: Move block with index 1  
  Step4: Move block with index 3  
  Step5: Move block with index 3  
}
